cz.tzima.partialsshot.camera

Class RectangularCamera

  • java.lang.Object
    • cz.tzima.partialsshot.camera.RectangularCamera
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Camera

    public class RectangularCamera
extends java.lang.Object
implements Camera

    Camera which takes screenshot of the rectangular part of the screen. This rectangle is specified by two points, which lies on the same diagonal. Some examples of some possible coordinates (order is important!) and expected results follows. Rectangle is specified by the coordinates of the left top corner, width and height.

    • [0; 0], [5; 5] ~ rectangle([0; 0], w=5, h=5)
    • [5; 5], [0; 0] ~ rectangle([0; 0], w=5, h=5)
    • [5; 0], [0; 5] ~ rectangle([0; 0], w=5, h=5)
    • [0; 5], [5; 0] ~ rectangle([0; 0], w=5, h=5)
    Author:
    Tomas Zima

      • takeScreenshot

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage takeScreenshot(java.util.List<java.awt.Point> points)
                                            throws CameraActionException,
                                                   InvalidAreaSelectException
        Takes screenshot of the rectangular part of the screen.
        Specified by:
        takeScreenshot in interface Camera
        Parameters:
        points - Two points lying on the same diagonal.
        Returns:
        Screenshot of the part of the screen.
        Throws:
        CameraActionException - When the internal technical error occurs.
        InvalidAreaSelectException - When user selected invalid points.

      • getRectangle

        protected static java.awt.Rectangle getRectangle(java.awt.Point firstCorner,
                                                 java.awt.Point secondCorner)
                                          throws InvalidAreaSelectException
        Returns rectangle specified by two points, which are located on the same diagonal (doesn't matter which one of the two). It correctly detects the way of the diagonal, therefore allowing to choose the two points in any order.
        Parameters:
        firstCorner - First ending point lying on the diagonal.
        secondCorner - Second enging point lying on the same diagonal.
        Returns:
        Rectangle with the specified diagonal.
        Throws:
        InvalidAreaSelectException - The points doesn't lie on the same diagonal.

      • getRequiredPointsCount

        public int getRequiredPointsCount()
        This implementation needs two points.
        Specified by:
        getRequiredPointsCount in interface Camera
        Returns:
        2
